page.title: 06HUDAWI CENTRE HUDDERSFIELD
page.content: The Hudawi Centre - Huddersfield Afro West Indian Centre - was once a Junior School. When the surrounding area was cleared of much of its housing the school became a Civic Youth Club and headquarters for the Caribbean Association. At the time of council cuts Youth Club closed and the building became very dilpidated. The Caribbean Ass. and Black Unity applied for an Urban Aid Grant. It now houses a Drop In Centre, Self Aid Scheme:- woodwork room, sign writing, sewing, tailoring./for unemployed W.I.There is also a B.B.C. computer, video making, recording studio. Various Caribbean groups use the centre and a Steel Band practices there. Hudawi will also be the centre for next year's Caribbean Focus.
